input_text: The user writes text in the text box, the program parses the text, and the program returns a list of nouns and a list of verbs

narratives.box:
Noun: a (usually rectangular) container; may have a lid
Noun: private area in a theater or grandstand where a small group can watch the performance
Noun: the quantity contained in a box
Noun: a predicament from which a skillful or graceful escape is impossible
Noun: a rectangular drawing
Noun: evergreen shrubs or small trees
Noun: any one of several designated areas on a ball field where the batter or catcher or coaches are positioned
Noun: the driver's seat on a coach
Noun: separate partitioned area in a public place for a few people
Noun: a blow with the hand (usually on the ear)
Verb: put into a box
Verb: hit with the fist
Verb: engage in a boxing match
narratives.list:
Noun: a database containing an ordered array of items (names or topics)
Noun: the property possessed by a line or surface that departs from the vertical
Verb: give or make a list of; name individually; give the names of
Verb: include in a list
Verb: cause to lean to the side
Verb: tilt to one side
Verb: enumerate
narratives.nouns:
Noun: a content word that can be used to refer to a person, place, thing, quality, or action
Noun: the word class that can serve as the subject or object of a verb, the object of a preposition, or in apposition
narratives.parses: Verb: analyze syntactically by assigning a constituent structure to (a sentence)
narratives.program:
Noun: a series of steps to be carried out or goals to be accomplished
Noun: a system of projects or services intended to meet a public need
Noun: a radio or television show
Noun: a document stating the aims and principles of a political party
Noun: an announcement of the events that will occur as part of a theatrical or sporting event
Noun: an integrated course of academic studies
Noun: (computer science) a sequence of instructions that a computer can interpret and execute
Noun: a performance (or series of performances) at a public presentation
Verb: arrange a program of or for
Verb: write a computer program
narratives.returns:
Noun: document giving the tax collector information about the taxpayer's tax liability
Noun: a coming to or returning home
Noun: the occurrence of a change in direction back in the opposite direction
Noun: getting something back again
Noun: the act of going back to a prior location
Noun: the income or profit arising from such transactions as the sale of land or other property
Noun: happening again (especially at regular intervals)
Noun: a quick reply to a question or remark (especially a witty or critical one)
Noun: the key on electric typewriters or computer keyboards that causes a carriage return and a line feed
Noun: a reciprocal group action
Noun: a tennis stroke that sends the ball back to the other player
Noun: (American football) the act of running back the ball after a kickoff or punt or interception or fumble
Noun: the act of someone appearing again
Verb: go or come back to place, condition, or activity where one has been before
Verb: give back
Verb: go back to a previous state
Verb: go back to something earlier
Verb: bring back to the point of departure
Verb: return in kind
Verb: make a return
Verb: answer back
Verb: be restored
Verb: pay back
Verb: pass down
Verb: elect again
Verb: be inherited by
Verb: return to a previous position; in mathematics
Verb: give or supply
Verb: submit (a report, etc.) to someone in authority
narratives.text:
Noun: the words of something written
Noun: a passage from the Bible that is used as the subject of a sermon
Noun: a book prepared for use in schools or colleges
Noun: the main body of a written work (as distinct from illustrations or footnotes etc.)
narratives.user:
Noun: a person who makes use of a thing; someone who uses or employs something
Noun: a person who uses something or someone selfishly or unethically
Noun: a person who takes drugs
narratives.verbs:
Noun: the word class that serves as the predicate of a sentence
Noun: a content word that denotes an action, occurrence, or state of existence
narratives.writes:
Verb: produce a literary work
Verb: communicate or express by writing
Verb: have (one's written work) issued for publication
Verb: communicate (with) in writing
Verb: communicate by letter
Verb: write music
Verb: mark or trace on a surface
Verb: record data on a computer
Verb: write or name the letters that comprise the conventionally accepted form of (a word or part of a word)
Verb: create code, write a computer program
